subject: [Bug 1118032] Calibre wont open with erro 2 'it_wasnt_me.ttf' not found
msg_body:
http://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1118032
http://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1118032#c1

--- Comment #1 from Cor Blom <cornelis@xxxxxxxxx> ---
I do not see this on my system. Calibre is starting fine on 15.0.

I remember having seen this issue in the past, but I don't remember the
details. I think it went away after a reinstall I did shortly after, which
would suggest it had something to do with the local system.

Can you try calibre from Documentation:Tools? [1] Some time ago the ways fonts
were dealt with was changed in the package. It builds against a not updated
version of 15.0, but I think there are no relevant updates that should cause
trouble. If it does not start with a different error message, I'll provide a
updated build against update/Leap?15.0/

BTW: The best way to update to suggested version is first uninstalling the old
one. Or ignoring the warning. It is a kind of change that rpm is not happy
with.

[1]
https://download.opensuse.org/repositories/Documentation:/Tools/openSUSE_Leap_15.0/

--

subject: [Bug 1118032] New: Calibre wont open with erro 2 'it_wasnt_me.ttf' not found
msg_body:
http://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1118032


            Bug ID: 1118032
           Summary: Calibre wont open with erro 2 'it_wasnt_me.ttf' not
                    found
    Classification: openSUSE
           Product: openSUSE Distribution
           Version: Leap 15.0
          Hardware: x86-64
                OS: Other
            Status: NEW
          Severity: Normal
          Priority: P5 - None
         Component: Other
          Assignee: bnc-team-screening@xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
          Reporter: maninredd@xxxxxxxxx
        QA Contact: qa-bugs@xxxxxxx
          Found By: ---
           Blocker: ---

User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML,
like Gecko) Chrome/70.0.3538.102 Safari/537.36
Build Identifier: 

~> calibre
qt5ct: using qt5ct plugin
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/calibre", line 20, in <module>
    sys.exit(calibre())
  File "/usr/lib64/calibre/calibre/gui_launch.py", line 73, in calibre
    main(args)
  File "/usr/lib64/calibre/calibre/gui2/main.py", line 567, in main
    gui_debug=gui_debug)
  File "/usr/lib64/calibre/calibre/gui2/main.py", line 391, in run_gui
    app.load_builtin_fonts(scan_for_fonts=True)
  File "/usr/lib64/calibre/calibre/gui2/__init__.py", line 927, in
load_builtin_fonts
    load_builtin_fonts()
  File "/usr/lib64/calibre/calibre/gui2/__init__.py", line 745, in
load_builtin_fonts
    with open(ff, 'rb') as s:
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
"/usr/share/calibre/fonts/liberation/It_wasn't_me.ttf"


Unsure what the issue is.  tried forcing a reinstall and switching versions. 
This did not help.  I did not test any version older than one update back, so i
am unsure if there is a regression that appeared since i last had calibre
working.


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.open calibre
2.nothing happens
3.open calibre in a terminal
4. Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/calibre", line 20, in <module>
    sys.exit(calibre())
  File "/usr/lib64/calibre/calibre/gui_launch.py", line 73, in calibre
    main(args)
  File "/usr/lib64/calibre/calibre/gui2/main.py", line 567, in main
    gui_debug=gui_debug)
  File "/usr/lib64/calibre/calibre/gui2/main.py", line 391, in run_gui
    app.load_builtin_fonts(scan_for_fonts=True)
  File "/usr/lib64/calibre/calibre/gui2/__init__.py", line 927, in
load_builtin_fonts
    load_builtin_fonts()
  File "/usr/lib64/calibre/calibre/gui2/__init__.py", line 745, in
load_builtin_fonts
    with open(ff, 'rb') as s:
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
"/usr/share/calibre/fonts/liberation/It_wasn't_me.ttf"

Actual Results:  
Calibre didnt open

Expected Results:  
Calibre opening

System Information:

Desktop: Xfce 4.12.4

subject: [Bug 1117086] Automatic cleanup of old kernels not working
msg_body:
http://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1117086
http://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1117086#c6

Philippe Condé <conde.philippe@xxxxxxxxx> changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |conde.philippe@xxxxxxxxx

--- Comment #6 from Philippe Condé <conde.philippe@xxxxxxxxx> ---
Hello,

I see the same problem in Tumbleweed but this seems related to the kernel-xen
requirement. I use the Xen Hypervisor but this problem in on the dom0 server
not a VM

if I start purge-kernels i receive the next error
# purge-kernels
error: Failed dependencies:
        kernel-xen is needed by (installed)
patterns-server-xen_server-20180718-1.1.x86_64
        kernel-xen is needed by (installed)
patterns-server-xen_server-20180718-1.1.x86_64
        kernel-xen is needed by (installed)
patterns-server-xen_server-20180718-1.1.x86_64
        kernel-xen is needed by (installed)
patterns-server-xen_server-20180718-1.1.x86_64
/sbin/purge-kernels: giving up.

if I search the requirements
# rpm -q --requires patterns-server-xen_server
kernel-xen
pattern() = basesystem
rpmlib(CompressedFileNames) <= 3.0.4-1
rpmlib(FileDigests) <= 4.6.0-1
rpmlib(PayloadFilesHavePrefix) <= 4.0-1
rpmlib(PayloadIsXz) <= 5.2-1
tftp
xen
xen-libs
xen-tools


As the kernel-xen has been removed/changed in 2016 maybe these requirements are
not more needed?

Regards
Philippe

--
